title: How to Make Chocolate Raspberry Crumb Bars

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 F (176.66 C).
Grease a 9 x 13 inch (22.9 x 30.5 cm) baking dish or pan to make crumb bars that will be easy to remove.
Beat 1 1/2 cup (338 g) of softened butter or margarine in a large mixing bowl until it is smooth and creamy.
Combine 3/4 cup (170 g) of firmly packed light brown sugar with 3 cups (679 g) of an all-purpose flour and 1/4 tsp.
steps.description: (1 ml) of salt in a separate medium bowl. Stir the ingredients.

steps.headline: Pour the dry ingredients into the creamy butter and beat on low setting until the dry ingredients are incorporated.
Dip your fingers into flour and press and flatten 1 3/4 cup (395 g) of the mixture onto the bottom of your prepared pan.
Set the remainder of the crumb mixture aside.
Bake the crust for approximately 10 minutes or until the crust is slightly brown.
Melt 1 cup (225 g) of chocolate morsels with a 14-oz (414 ml) can of condensed milk in a saucepan over a low temperature and stir the chocolate dessert until smooth.
Pour the hot filling over your prepared crust, spreading it evenly over the crumbs.
Stir 1/2 cup (113 g) of chopped nuts into the reserved crumb mixture and sprinkle it over the warm filling.
Drop 1/3 cup (79 ml) seedless raspberry jam by the teaspoon over the crumb mixture.
Top your chocolate raspberry dessert with the remaining chocolate morsels.
Pop the dessert in the oven for another 25 minutes or until the center sets completely.
Cool the chocolate dessert completely before slicing it into bars.
Store the leftovers in an airtight container and keep in the refrigerator.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 F (176.66 C).  Grease a 9 x 13 inch (22.9 x 30.5 cm) baking dish or pan to make crumb bars that will be easy to remove.  Beat 1 1/2 cup (338 g) of softened butter or margarine in a large mixing bowl until it is smooth and creamy.  Combine 3/4 cup (170 g) of firmly packed light brown sugar with 3 cups (679 g) of an all-purpose flour and 1/4 tsp. (1 ml) of salt in a separate medium bowl. Stir the ingredients. Pour the dry ingredients into the creamy butter and beat on low setting until the dry ingredients are incorporated.  Dip your fingers into flour and press and flatten 1 3/4 cup (395 g) of the mixture onto the bottom of your prepared pan.  Set the remainder of the crumb mixture aside.  Bake the crust for approximately 10 minutes or until the crust is slightly brown.  Melt 1 cup (225 g) of chocolate morsels with a 14-oz (414 ml) can of condensed milk in a saucepan over a low temperature and stir the chocolate dessert until smooth.  Pour the hot filling over your prepared crust, spreading it evenly over the crumbs.  Stir 1/2 cup (113 g) of chopped nuts into the reserved crumb mixture and sprinkle it over the warm filling.  Drop 1/3 cup (79 ml) seedless raspberry jam by the teaspoon over the crumb mixture.  Top your chocolate raspberry dessert with the remaining chocolate morsels.  Pop the dessert in the oven for another 25 minutes or until the center sets completely.  Cool the chocolate dessert completely before slicing it into bars.  Store the leftovers in an airtight container and keep in the refrigerator.
